title: Elements of an Experiment
question_text: Of the following, which is/are important elements of a well-designed experiment?
solution:
Solution

The three essential parts of an experiment are randomness, replication, and control.

So, Choice 'E' is correct.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice ‘A’ is incorrect: Randomness is the most important element of any experiment but replication and control are also vital elements.

Choice ‘B’ is incorrect: Randomness and replication are important elements of a well-designed experiment but without control, comparisons are difficult or impossible to make.

Choice ‘C’ is incorrect: Randomness and control are important elements of a well-designed experiment but without replication, trends are difficult to determine. Researchers need to be able to determine if the results of the experiment are due to chance or due to a causal relationship.

Choice ‘D’ is incorrect: Replication and control are important elements of a well-designed experiment but without randomness, bias is very likely to occur.
